question.name: 38.1.1.5 The Cumulative Distribution Function
question.questiontext:
The Cumulative Distribution Function

Analogous to the formula for the cumulative distribution function:

        \(F(x) = \displaystyle{\sum_{x_i \leq x}} \text{P}(X = x_i) \)

used in the case of a discrete random variable \(X\) with associated probabilities \(\text{P}(X = x_i)\), we define a cumulative probability distribution function (cdf) \(F(x)\) by means of the integral (being a form of a sum): 

        \(F(x) = \displaystyle{\int_{-\infty}^x} f(t) \; dt \)

The cdf represents the probability of observing a value less than or equal to \(x\).
